'West Orange' is a township in central Essex County, New Jersey, United States.
As of the 2010 United States Census, the township's population was 46,207, reflecting an
increase of 1,264 (+2.8%) from the 44,943 counted in the 2000 Census, which had
in turn increased by 5,840 (+14.9%) from the 39,103 counted in the 1990 Census.-
[http://lwd.dol.state.nj.us/labor/lpa/census/2010/2010data/table7cm.xls
Table 7. Population for the Counties and Municipalities in New Jersey: 1990,
2000 and 2010], New Jersey Department of Labor and Workforce Development,
February 2011. Accessed July 12, 2012.

The township is set off by two large parks: the South Mountain Reservation along
its southwestern borders with Maplewood and Millburn, [http://www.essex-
countynj.org/p/index.php?section=parks/sites/so South Mountain Reservation],
Essex County, New Jersey Department of Parks, Recreation, and Cultural Affairs.
Accessed May 23, 2012. and the Eagle Rock Reservation along its
northeastern borders with Montclair and Verona. [http://www.essex-
countynj.org/p/index.php?section=parks/sites/er Eagle Rock Reservation], Essex
County, New Jersey Department of Parks, Recreation, and Cultural Affairs.
Accessed May 23, 2012. The township straddles the transition between the
low-lying Newark Bay basin and the high terrain of the Watchung Mountains.
categories: Townships in Essex County, New Jersey
